column2: Warning: You must enter a valid hostname. The hostname is the bolded part of the following URL: http://www.example.com/path/index.html

column1: Are you sure you want to flush the image cache?
column2: Are you sure you want to flush the image cache?

column1: Auto-configuration has been disabled in the demo. When you install the extension on your store you can use auto-configuration.
column2: Auto-configuration has been disabled in the demo. When you install the extension on your store you can use auto-configuration.

column1: Auto-configuration is NOT a substitute for configuring manually. Auto-configuration can usually (but not always) pick decent settings to help you get started. After auto-configuration you should review all settings and ensure they work. Do you want to continue?
column2: Auto-configuration is NOT a substitute for configuring manually. Auto-configuration can usually (but not always) pick decent settings to help you get started. After auto-configuration you should review all settings and ensure they work. Do you want to continue?

column1: Auto-configuration will usually configure your site fairly well, but it is not perfect. Please review each configuration item and verify optimum settings have been selected.
column2: Auto-configuration will usually configure your site fairly well, but it is not perfect. Please review each configuration item and verify optimum settings have been selected.

column1: Cache catalog images and add forever expirations
column2: Cache catalog images and add forever expirations

column1: Cache CSS images and add forever expirations. Note: Minify JS / CSS must be installed for this to work. If this is not installed you can Custom Directories top optimize css images.
column2: Cache CSS images and add forever expirations. Note: Minify JS / CSS must be installed for this to work. If this is not installed you can Custom Directories top optimize css images.

column1: Cache skin images and add forever expirations
column2: Cache skin images and add forever expirations

column1: Cache template media images such as those found in cms pages using {{media url=""}
column2: Cache template media images such as those found in cms pages using {{media url=""}

column1: Configuration is already optimal according to auto-configuration. You can review the configuration manually to further optimize as auto-configuration is limited in scope.
column2: Configuration is already optimal according to auto-configuration. You can review the configuration manually to further optimize as auto-configuration is limited in scope.

column1: Cronjob will optimize every few hours whereas realtime will optimize as pages are accessed. Warning: realtime will cause first requests to be slow until the images are cached
column2: Cronjob will optimize every few hours whereas realtime will optimize as pages are accessed. Warning: realtime will cause first requests to be slow until the images are cached

column1: Did you know purchasing %s can speed up your store even more?
column2: Did you know purchasing %s can speed up your store even more?

column1: Disabling this is faster, but will require you to flush the cache if changing images.
column2: Disabling this is faster, but will require you to flush the cache if changing images.

column1: Enter directories relative to the base path where images should also be optimized. For example, /media/wysiwyg/. Warning: This will permanently change images in these directories. Ensure you backup first!
column2: Enter directories relative to the base path where images should also be optimized. For example, /media/wysiwyg/. Warning: This will permanently change images in these directories. Ensure you backup first!

column1: Having different hostnames for different resources can speed up downloads. <u>Only change these values if you are know exactly what you are doing.</u>
column2: Having different hostnames for different resources can speed up downloads. <u>Only change these values if you are know exactly what you are doing.</u>

column2: Leave blank to use the default hostname. This value must be valid or the resource will not load.

column1: This will rewrite catalog images and apply expiration headers to them. This will use a lot more hard disk space.
column2: This will rewrite catalog images and apply expiration headers to them. This will use a lot more hard disk space.

column1: This will rewrite CSS images and apply expiration headers to them to make the best use of the browser cache.
column2: This will rewrite CSS images and apply expiration headers to them to make the best use of the browser cache.

column1: This will rewrite skin images and apply expiration headers to them. This will use a lot more hard disk space.
column2: This will rewrite skin images and apply expiration headers to them. This will use a lot more hard disk space.

column1: This will rewrite template images and apply expiration headers to them. This will use a lot more hard disk space.
column2: This will rewrite template images and apply expiration headers to them. This will use a lot more hard disk space.

column1: Updated to %s because exec() is disabled. Contact your host to enable.
column2: Updated to %s because exec() is disabled. Contact your host to enable.

column1: Updated to %s because software is not installed on the server: %s. Contact your host to install this software.
column2: Updated to %s because software is not installed on the server: %s. Contact your host to install this software.

column1: Use the product name for catalog images
column2: Use the product name for catalog images

column1: Utility used to optimize gif images. This utility will need to be installed on your server for optimizing to work. Leave blank to disable
column2: Utility used to optimize gif images. This utility will need to be installed on your server for optimizing to work. Leave blank to disable

column1: Utility used to optimize jpg images. This utility will need to be installed on your server for optimizing to work. Leave blank to disable. Add "--all-progressive --force" to force progressive images
column2: Utility used to optimize jpg images. This utility will need to be installed on your server for optimizing to work. Leave blank to disable. Add "--all-progressive --force" to force progressive images

column1: Utility used to optimize png images. This utility will need to be installed on your server for optimizing to work. Leave blank to disable Note: You can use the command pngquant -force 256 %s 2>&1 if you have pngquant installed and are okay with lossy compression.
column2: Utility used to optimize png images. This utility will need to be installed on your server for optimizing to work. Leave blank to disable Note: You can use the command pngquant -force 256 %s 2>&1 if you have pngquant installed and are okay with lossy compression.

column1: WARNING: normally you should not run this this through the web server. The cronjob will automatically optimize images. Please note, an image must be accessed on the site one time before it is optimized in most cases. Are you sure you want to proceed?
column2: WARNING: normally you should not run this this through the web server. The cronjob will automatically optimize images. Please note, an image must be accessed on the site one time before it is optimized in most cases. Are you sure you want to proceed?
